IRS990.Desc: SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS ATTENDING PASADENA CITY COLLEGE

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: VARIOUS GRANTS ADMINISTERED BY THE FOUNDATION THAT BENEFIT THE COLLEGE AND ITS STUDENTS

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: VARIOUS AGENCY FUNDS ADMINISTERED BY THE FOUNDATION THAT BENEFIT THE COLLEGE AND ITS STUDENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION HAS ADOPTED FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION (ASC) TOPIC 740 THAT CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN, ON A TAX RETURN AND PROVIDES THAT THE TAX EFFECTS FROM AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION CAN BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ONLY IF, BASED ON ITS MERITS, THE POSITION IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT TO BE SUSTAINED ON AUDIT BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES THAT ALL TAX POSITIONS TAKEN TO DATE ARE HIGHLY CERTAIN AND, ACCORDINGLY, NO ACCOUNTING ADJUSTMENT HAS BEEN MADE TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

PASADENA CITY COLLEGE USES THE SCHOLARSHIP MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, ACADEMIC WORKS, TO FACILITATE ALL SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS, REVIEWS AND AWARDS. AS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED DURING DIFFERENT PERIODS DURING THE ACADEMIC YEAR, THE APPLICATION SYSTEM IS OPEN AT DIFFERENT TIMES. STUDENTS APPLY, REVIEW GROUPS READ AND SCORE APPLICATIONS, AND VARIOUS COMMITTEES MAKE CHOICES. THOSE SCHOLARSHIP AWARDEES ARE SHARED WITH THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, WHO ENTER THE AWARDS IN OUR CAMPUS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM, BANNER. A DISBURSEMENT CYCLE RUNS; IF THE STUDENT OWES A BALANCE TO THE COLLEGE, THE SCHOLARSHIP WILL OFFSET THIS. THE STUDENT RECEIVES A REIMBURSEMENT OF THE DIFFERENCE OR THE ENTIRE AMOUNT IF NO BALANCE IS OWED. THANK YOU LETTERS ARE WRITTEN AND UPLOADED INTO THE SCHOLARSHIP MANAGEMENT SYSTEM BEFORE BEING SENT TO THE DONOR.
THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS REPRESENT THE NUMBER OF DONORS.
OPERATE A FLEA MARKET AND STARTED POSEY LOAN PROGRAM

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE A COMMITTEE WITH AUTHORITY TO ACT ON ITS BEHALF.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WILL BE COMPLETED ANNUALLY AND COPIES WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE PASADENA CITY COLLEGE FOUNDATION BOARD PRESIDENT, TREASURER, DEAN OF THE DEPARTMENT AND DEPARTMENT ACCOUNTANT. THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL REVIEW THE FORM 990 WITH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE. ANY NECESSARY CHANGES WILL THEN BE UPDATED ON THE FORM. ONCE ALL NECESSARY CHANGES ARE MADE AND THE FOUNDATION PRESIDENT IS IN AGREEMENT WITH THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, DEPARTMENT DEAN, DEPARTMENT ACCOUNTANT AND TREASURER ABOUT THE FINISHED FORM 990, IT WILL BE SIGNED BY THE FOUNDATION PRESIDENT, DATED AND SUBMITTED BY THE FILING DEADLINE. A COPY OF THE APPROVED 990 WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL OF THE FOUNDATION OFFICERS AND DIRECTORS. A FILE COPY WILL BE KEPT IN THE REGULAR FOUNDATION FILES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENTS ARE SIGNED BY THE BOARD MEMBERS. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR MONITORS THE STATEMENTS. IF A CONFLICT ARISES, THEN THE BOARD MEMBER IS ASKED TO EXCUSE HIMSELF/HERSELF FROM ALL VOTING AND DISCUSSIONS CONCERNING THE ISSUE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST AT THE ORGANIZATION'S BUSINESS ADDRESS DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF FUNDS WITH FCCC -316,962.
